description.narrative: All schools commit to the 2 year PAT, and contribute to its success., Secure water supply to the school for their water needs during the school day., Safe and reliable sanitation services (including toilets and waste treatment) to the school for needs during the school day., Good hygiene practice demonstrated by the school children, and the public health risks of poor hygiene and poor process to WASH services is understood, Create a report on best practices and lessons learned from the project., Identify lessons to be learned from the project., Assess the results of the project against what was intended to achieve.

The “Green Schools” Programme has twice been supported by an ERD Grant, once in 2011 and once in 2013. 2015 is therefore the 5th year of the programme, and it is the year that the programme will officially enter its 2yr. M&E period, after the official handover to the schools occurs on the 13th June 2015 . The programme title relevant to this planning worksheet is therefore: “Finalization and handing over of “Green Schools”” In order for this handover to take place, in 2015, NCA launched a rehabilitation project with hardware and software components in order to solve outstanding technical issues such as; • Biodigesters: Very little biogas is produced and used from the biodigesters, and the biodigesters achieve very poor wastewater treatment efficiencies. • Water supply systems do not allow for maintenance or testing of the water source. The Programme was designed to provide a sustainable WASH service package to 10 schools in the Leogane area west of Port-au-Prince, and 1 school in Jacmel. The WASH service package comprises the following components, or ‘volets’: 1. Sanitation using biodigesters with 3 objectives: (1) Decentralized wastewater treatment, (2) recycle and reuse the nutrients in the effluent, and (3) produce biogas through anaerobic biological digestion (ABD) of organic wastes; human waste and animal waste. 2. Water supply using new boreholes and solar pumps. 3. Rainwater collection and storage. 4. Hygiene Promotion through school hygiene groups called ‘Heroes’. 5. Solid Waste Management
